page.title: 03Geography and Ecology
page.content: The wildlife of the area is quite abundant:in the woods one may glimpse fallow and muntjac deer and foxes,and find adders and grass snakes in the bracken of the clearings.Rabbits are plentiful.There is a fine rookery in the middle of the village.The woods are full of jays ,magpies,woodpigeons,tits and finches.Hawfinches come each spring to an area of hornbeams.Not many flowers grow in the woods themselves, but there are still hedges and verges where the flowers of the chalkland can be found,and in patches of older woodland,where beech gives way to oak and cherry,one can find ramsons and sanicle,wood goldilocks,twayblade and early purple orchids.
